intro: Echinella vittata, commonly known as the spotted echinella, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically yellow with a central disc, and it produces small, dry fruits called achenes. Echinella vittata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
